page.title: 19NORHEADS FARM BIGGIN HILL
page.content: There has been a farm at Norheads since Norman times. The old spelling of the word was NORRADS.Agriculture on the western slopes of the valley has generally been dairy and cereal farming,the strawberry and raspberry growing on the CUDHAM side of the valley.The fine Queen Anne style residence built for John Clover about 1715 indicates the prosperity of the farm and lifestyle of the gentleman farmer of that period.The Clover family are buried in Cudham churchyard.There are still the fire marks issued by the early insurance companies fixed to the outside of the house.The Norman family of Bromley Common owned the farm in the late 1800's.
